website_summaries.verdict: Designed to be a compact size and with comfort in mind, this is the ideal manual pump for travel or a busy lifestyle.
pros: This manual pump is easy to disassemble and clean
Is known to help produce more milk than even electric pumps
Small enough to fit under shirt
Has a comfortable design to ensure hands don’t cramp

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, needs a S or XS shield size
customer_reviews.text: Great little pump, 1 star off for lack of shield size choices. Bonus direct pump if you use Lansinoh Momma bottles. Potentially a great little hand pump with no squeaky handles or leaky shields (looking at you, Philips Avent), fantastic suction, super quick letdown induction, a nice stand, got a lot of milk each time- I mean like 5oz in under 8 mins flat. Unfortunately for me, the shield sizes seem to be equivalent to Medela Medium 24mm and XL(?) which is too big. So although the mechanics are very nice, I've only been willing to use this pump 3-4 times in a pinch (double electric veteran), because the too-big shield causes sore boobs afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Digital Kamerad

customer_reviews.title: My favorite!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pump! I have a double electric and I get nowhere near the amount of milk that I get with this. It's super easy to disassemble and clean. Milk and water do get in the rubber suction area, but all you have to do is pull the rubber up with the flange off and all of the liquid will come out.
customer_reviews.author: Kacey

customer_reviews.title: Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Great for portable pumping (especially when I'm on the back seat of the car on a long trip!) works well- I get just about as much as my electric pump. Only thing that's kind of annoying is that there are a lot of parts to put together/take apart/wash each time. But I feel like the only pumping solution without a million parts to clean is the hakaa. Which is a bit of a different concept anyway. I do recommend this product if you are out and about a lot and need to pump without having to plug in somewhere. It's also a lot less to lug around than the big electric pump even if you do have an outlet handy.
customer_reviews.author: john gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Maybe even better it’s comfortable that’s one and the suction on this ...
customer_reviews.text: I was iffy about getting a manual breast pump, but this thing here works as well as a electric pump. Maybe even better it’s comfortable that’s one and the suction on this pump is great, happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aniysa

customer_reviews.title: Must have pump for every mumma
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have pump to all mummas our there.I have medela pump in style but bought this pump for road trip.I cannot believe within 2 days my milk was double.I hardly get any milk from right side but after using this pump my milk flow is back.The design of the pump is awesome I never get tired pumping.Thank you Lansinoh for making such a life saver pump for mother struggling with milk production.Highly recommend to give it a try,you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: alka anand

customer_reviews.title: Prefer this over my electric pump
customer_reviews.text: I already have a high quality electric pump, but I ordered this one because I don’t always have an outlet available at work to pump. I was worried that this pump wouldn’t have enough suction and that I wouldn’t collect as much milk, but the exact opposite is true. I am able to pump just as much milk and in the same time or less. I actually prefer this manual due to the fact that it’s more portable, easier to clean, and is quieter than my electric. I would recommend this product for working moms that are looking for a quieter and convenient alternative

customer_reviews.title: Great manual pump!
customer_reviews.text: If you pump this is a must! Especially if you out and about, don’t have to carry around you’re electric pump. I actually get more sometimes when I use my manual pump. I like it at night cause it pretty quite.
customer_reviews.author: MG

customer_reviews.title: Zero Suction whatsoever.
customer_reviews.text: ABSOLUTELY ZERO SUCTION. The suction isn't even strong enough to suck my breast/nipple into the flange let alone pull any milk out. I'm already at my witts end being an exclusive pumper and I bought this for my camping trip which is in two days and now I don't know what I'm going to do to be able to pump. I trusted the glowing reviews about this product only to be disappointed. My husband even said it sucks, and not in the way its suppose to. Save your money Mama's.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Awful pump!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pump as a backup to have during travel. I HATE this pump. I usually pump between 15-25 ounces each time I pump with my double electric (Spectra 2) pump for 20-25 minutes. I can barely pump 8 ounces with this thing AND it takes about an hour to do that! I had a manual pump 15 years ago that was awesome. This one doesn’t even come close to that one. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: J Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is amazing!!! I bought it to use at night and early mornings so I won’t have to get the electric pump set up. It’s been super easy to use, a lot less painful, it’s faster. I also get more milk out then with the electric. It’s become my go to pump. Also, for those needing a smaller flange size, the Medela ones fit perfectly. You can also use other bottles. Today I used my avent glass bottles to pump.
customer_reviews.author: Alla

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this pump unless you have large nipples. Both flanges that are included are way too big and make pumping painful and inefficient. I bought this while I’m waiting for my electric pump to come in and it’s horrible! Also: it leaks from the flanges while pumping!! I don’t know if it’s the angle or what, but I keep losing milk that goes down the flange instead of into the bottle. Hate this pump. Only bonus: it’s fairly easy to clean and assemble.
customer_reviews.author: MoDa

customer_reviews.title: Buy without hesitation!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, where do I start with this pump! I am breastfeeding and pumping on occasion with the medela electric pump. I wish I bought this manual pump right from the beginning. I pumped more in a few minutes using this vs 15 min using the electric pump. Very simple to use, simple to clean and great for travel. If you are on the fence, buy it- you will not regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Peaceful_Soul

customer_reviews.title: Hard Pass
customer_reviews.text: I EP with a Spectra but I wanted something easy to toss in my purse for a few trips. I read the reviews between a few manual pumps and settled on this one. But I was really disappointed. I could not get a good suction on it at all. The silicons catchers get a better suction than this. I didn't expect an electric pump suction but I expected for it to at least work. Booo for this. It's getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: 😬
customer_reviews.text: Ok ladies...so I bought this pump right after I brought my baby home. I had decided that I was going to solely breastfeed my little bundle of joy. This is or was my first pump and first time using one......needless to say my friends I used this pump maybe 4 or 5 times. The pump works well I guess but I couldn’t take the concentrated suction on my aureolas and nipples. Maybe I’m a sissy idk but I took more comfort with my babies natural way of sucking. Good luck to the breast pumpers, I didn’t make it ladies. P.s. On the plus side it is easy to use, take apart, and clean.
customer_reviews.author: ABENA

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Good once I got used to it. I'm using it to induce lactation (without giving birth) because I'm in an ANR. Works well so far, good for my purposes. Very happy with the price, too!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Minimal Suction
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a manual pump for travel and because I heard they tend to express more milk and I am pumping and not latching baby. I read a lot of reviews and decided to go with Lansinoh over Medela. I didn’t get any more out than I do with my EvenFlo electric pump and the suction really...well, sucked. I was pretty disappointed as I thought this would be a saving grace. Luckily Amazon accepted the return. I would either go with another brand or just stick with your electric pumps!
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Pumping MUST Have!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this hand pump!! I regret not getting this sooner! I have an electric dual pump, but this one is so much more convenient, and for me faster!! I can empty my breast in half the time as my electric, and I love how I can feed my baby on one side and empty the other. This helps create my freezer stash or a bottle for dad to give, and prevents me from being lopsided! Shipping was super fast and packaging was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Krysten R

customer_reviews.title: Sucks great and then it doesn’t
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this at most dozen times since I bought it a week ago. It was easy to assemble, easy to clean and easy to use. At first the suction was very strong, but the past few uses my nipples either really toughened up, or the suction has dwindled. I hand clean it in hot water every time, no boiling, no dish washer, no microwave. I think the piece that goes over the breast is too large, and I’m using the smaller of the 2 it comes with. Just for reference, my cup size pre baby was DDD. I wish they had ones with smaller suction areas. If this continued working correctly it would had definitely been 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This little pump has really helped me. I have gone out of town and used it in the car when we were busy for an entire day running around when I wouldn’t have time to pump. Probably saved my supply from dropping. I use a motif Luna at home (which I love). I recently broke out my Spectra from my last baby and it doesn’t work as well as this little hand pump. I’m currently using it as I type this. Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: This works pretty well and it's great to have when I don't ...
customer_reviews.text: This works pretty well and it's great to have when I don't want to or can't set up and use my double electric pump. I get a good amount of milk in a short time with only a little hand fatigue. I use this while driving at times too and it's very helpful to relieve engorgement then or in the middle of the night, anytime I don't want to use the electric pump.
customer_reviews.author: Zena

customer_reviews.title: Get a good amount of milk from it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for once a week pumping after my Medela automatic pump died. I just couldn’t foresee spending the money to replace it, so we tried this. It works just fine, it’s easy to clean as well. It does hurt a little bit when you first start nursing, but it ha we bought this for once a week pumping after my Medela automatic pump died. I just couldn’t foresee spending the money to replace it, so we tried this. It works just fine, it’s easy to clean as well. It does hurt a little bit when you first start nursing, but i Get a good amount of milk from it.
customer_reviews.author: Mamma Manda

customer_reviews.title: Better than medela, order maymom valves
customer_reviews.text: I love this little pump. It is very comfortable because there is a purple soft edge in the flange. It has a strong suction. I get more with this than other pumps. The only negative is the white duckbill membrane. I suggest ordering the “maymom valves” to go along with this because the duckbill valve it comes with really sucks, it’s loose and falls off into the milk.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Best Manual Pump
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Medela manual, and the avent manual pumps, but this is my favorite. I try to stay away from electric pumps, as I tend to create an oversupply for myself. This solves that problem when I'm engorged. I can pump to comfort, or pump off my overactive letdown, and baby is much happier. The suction is VERY good. My Avent lost its suction completely after a through washing. It's easy to get apart and put back together. I highly recommend this over other manual pumps--it just gets more out.
customer_reviews.author: Sammi

customer_reviews.title: Good in a pinch, but boy am I glad I have my electric pump
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a backup pump or one to use while travelling. The construction is great and I really like how much of it comes apart to make it easy to clean - I have a Medela Pump In Style electric pump and the connector pieces are so hard to clean well! However, I would never trade my Medela for a manual pump after using this a couple times. You really need to focus on holding it in the right position and pumping with the right intensity and rhythm. It's a tricky thing to do. It's better than hand expressing, but nowhere near as good as using a good electric pump, both in terms of ease and yield.
customer_reviews.author: KellyC

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I am obsessed with this pump! I had the Medela electric pump which I would use for HOURS and get very little flow / milk. I tried this for a bit and I ended up getting about 60 ml in 20 minutes (keep in mind that my supply is generally low so this is god sent for me). I use it on one breast and the Haakaa pump on the other and end up with a good amount for my daughter's next feeding. It is ALOT cheaper than electronic pumps but works SO much better! I am so glad I found this!
customer_reviews.author: RaR

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised how quickly it works!
customer_reviews.text: I'm totally loving this manual pump! I bought it to keep in the diaper bag for emergencies if I needed a pump while out and about and because of the flange, it's a little too big to fit in my diaper bag (I just need a bigger bag!) BUT I totally love it! My baby is only 5 weeks old and a good nurser so I haven't started pumping for work yet (I haven't even opened my fancy Spectra), but I have used this sucker a couple times already when I'm super engorged and need some relief. It's super easy to use and the milk comes out fast. Highly recommend it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing suction!
customer_reviews.text: I love this manual pump. I just wish there was a way to stick it to you rather than having to hold it. Otherwise this works really well. Sometimes even with my Medela pump, I feel lumpy and feel like the Medela flanges can't clear out the milk. So I follow with this and get another 1-2 oz sometimes. It works just as well and I feel less sore using this than an electric pump. The only drawback is that you need both hands, it could have been made a little more hands-free. The parts are easy to clean and easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: JYS

customer_reviews.title: Great for on the go pumping.
customer_reviews.text: I have an oversupply and use this to keep engorgement at bay. I was used to an electric pump after my first child was born but wanted to try a manual one as there are no chords or machine to carry around, even if it's just around the house. This pump works great! I can literally be anywhere and pump. The suction is great and the handle doesn't fatigue your hand. I especially like the 2 "speeds" to help with let down. I have since recommended this to other friends who recently had little ones.
customer_reviews.author: Betsi Head

customer_reviews.title: So grateful for this
customer_reviews.text: If you’re a stay at home mom and breastfeed full time, then you’re probably like me where you don’t need a full pumping machine. Also, this is SO MUCH easier to clean than a full machine. The Haaka works for catching let down, but if you don’t produce much then this is better. I’m really, really happy I got this to help my baby’s weaning transition (drinking milk from bottle / sippy cup instead of just from me). Really happy. Ps: Really pretty color too.
customer_reviews.author: annette828

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother
customer_reviews.text: When I tested this I was very impressed with its suction and couldn’t wait to use it. Went to use it and something has changed. When I adjusted from “let down” mode to actually pump, it’s like the whole thing is “let down” mode now. It does absolutely nothing. I got far more from my haaka than from this. Very disappointed to have lost money on something that doesn’t work. Had high hopes for this. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: miss sammyjo

customer_reviews.title: Didnt increase milk production
customer_reviews.text: Pros: The pump is extremely easy to use and easy to clean. Affordable. Cons: The smaller flange size is still a lot larger than the size I need therefore using this pump was painful. The suction can be very strong, and I found it to hurt if I used speed or force. If I tried to go slow or use less strength to pump it resulted in little to no suction. Overall this product didnt increase the amount of milk I was able to pump which is what I was hoping for based on some of the existing reviews.
customer_reviews.author: HappyShopper

customer_reviews.title: I love it for me
customer_reviews.text: My easy go to pump. My only negative: I use it daily so it is washed several times a day and has started to squeak a lot. Maybe it’s not intended to be used as much as I do I’m not sure. Either way I will be purchase a new one because it works great for me. The suction pressure is just as great as my medalla and Bella baby and way more convenient to use. I would recommend for mommy’s who hate the process of setting up and cleaning an electric pump
customer_reviews.author: Dedicated Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I exclusively breast feed but needed something in the middle of the night that I could quickly, easily, and soundly express milk if I was engorged and baby was sleeping. I kept this by my bedside and it was perfect. The suction isn’t super strong, but I was only looking to express enough to feel comfortable so it worked perfect for me. All the parts were easy to clean and I liked how milk was expressed directly into a bottle so it could be stored in the fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: A life saver for a busy mom or working mom. After 2 days of lugging my automatic pump to work, I bought this. I have to wear a looser shirt to have it fit under it but I think that would be all of them. With this I can pump and eat lunch at the same time at work or walk around the house. I only wish water didn’t get into the top when rinsing so I didn’t always have to take completely apart. But not a biggie.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this instead of a more expensive manual pump.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason it took longer for me to pump with this one than my Medela electric pump is it's a single and with an electric I can pump two sides at once. Took the same amount of time per side. Very simple and easy for on the go usage and could definitely be used as your main pump if you would like. If you're someone who needs to have your electric pump at full strength, this may not work as well for you, otherwise it should be fine. Glad I bought this instead of a more expensive manual pump.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and excellent suction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Avent manual pump, and it is so much nicer! I love the dual expression modes, and it’s easier to clean. It really is silent!! No squeaking!! Good suction and also it comes with a stand so I’m less worried about knocking it over at night in my baby-stupor :).
customer_reviews.author: gmcruns

customer_reviews.title: Best breast pump
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 breast pumps. This one is by far my favorite. You can operate it with one hand while baby drinks on other. The suction is very strong and milks sufficiently. I got much more milk with this pump than the other 2. The only down side was the fact that to cup it self is not silicone so it does not massage the breast as my electric pump did. I still prefer this one. It is easier to clean. Portable (no electricity needed) and fits in a diaper bag. It is much more affordable than the others.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite pump!
customer_reviews.text: Omg! My favorite pump!!!! I was using a old pump from my last child and it was not doing the job. I have never used a hand pump so I was a little skeptical to try it, it was the best purchase I could have made. I only pump once A-day so the manual style doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: ernie arana

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient!
customer_reviews.text: I own the Lansinoh smart double electric pump and it’s a really good pump! I yield 4oz in 20 mins but washing all the parts is so tedious. I but the manual pump as a back up and yesterday I went to a concert and took it with me and OMG! Got 4-5oz in 7 minutes! Holy cow! It’s amazing. I thought it would be tiring and uncomfortable but now, I can’t stop pumping!! I use it with my pumping pal flange. The lansinoh ones are too big for me and uncomfortable. And because they don’t fit right, it reduces the amount of milk I express per session. Highly recommend getting your hands on a manual pump.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My go to
customer_reviews.text: I gave two big brand well recommended electric double pumps and I still consistently prefer this manual pump overall. I get the most milk during pumping sessions with this. It’s also easier to carry with you while on the go. I like that I can control the suction with how fast or hard I pull the trigger which ultimate makes the rhythm feel more natural. I pretty much use this everyday every 3-4hrs and I’m exclusively pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Balanced Momma

customer_reviews.title: Prefer over automatic pump!
customer_reviews.text: This pump has been a life savor! I actually prefer it to my Spectra S2. I can pump 5-6 oz in each breast on my spectra in 15-20 mins. With this I pump 5 oz in under 5 mins, so about 10 mins total for each breast. My baby started sleeping though the night and my breast get engorged so instead of having to get hooked up to my spectra I can just quickly pump and go right back to sleep! It’s quiet and efficient and easy to travel with!
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Third times the charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third manual pump. I've finally found what works for me! I don't use the last down option as much as I thought I would but switching it when I do use it isn't complicated, did take a little time to get use to but it didn't take long. I really like that it came with a replacement valve too. At first I was worried it was because it quickly wore down but I haven't noticed any changes yet! I don't pump everyday right now but when I was this was pretty nice to have and if I do go back to pumping every day I'll probably grab this one over my electric pump again!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa E.

customer_reviews.title: Efficient, easy to assemble, use and clean
customer_reviews.text: I am a first time mom who stays at home and exclusively breastfeeds my 10 week old on demand. Therefore, this pump is only for occasional use and is the only one that I have ever used but I love it. I don't like to complicate things unnecessarily with too many bells and whistles and this pump fits the bill. It is so easy to assemble, use and clean. It can even be put in the dishwasher. It doesn't require an outlet nor is it noisy and you can't beat the price. It is also very efficient in that I am able to pump 1 ounce every 5 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Heather DTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Great pump and good quality
customer_reviews.text: This pump works great. I have this and also the double electric pump from lansinoh and find that they were great together, as I use the manual pump in between pumping with the electric or at night if I don't feel like getting up to go pump. It was easy to assemble and is also easy to clean. It's very convenient to take with me if I'm gone from home for a few hours or longer. This pump is a good quality manual pump and I would definitely purchase that again.
customer_reviews.author: Snaibedai

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient
customer_reviews.text: So glad I purchased this pump! I found that I needed a manual pump in addition to my spectra electric pump for when I was away from my baby in public and wanted something easy to store and didn’t have to be plugged in. I went with this one due to reviews and found that it’s super efficient and the suction is great. I’ve used for a couple of months now and no issue at all. Once I figured out how to get a letdown, it works just as well as my electric and quicker.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor White

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this pump for the first time and felt immediately compelled to write this review. This pump is fabulous and I am so glad I purchased this! I was completely shocked at how much milk I was able to express so quickly! I expressed 3 1/2 oz from one breast in 5 minutes! Plus, it is way more comfortable than my electric pump. I am amazed. This works so well for pumping after nursing if baby didn't empty your breast. This will be my new go to pump for when I am on the go as well. I am thoroughly pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Latrice Baez

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this pump
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my 8 month old started daycare because we use the Lansinoh mOmma bottles, with the idea that I’d use it while nursing him on whichever side he wasn’t on. Thinking it would help increase my supply and build a stash. As it turns out, I LOVE IT! I will gladly use this instead of my electric pump (a spectra, which is great). It’s faster, I love that I can put it down / walk around with it and it’s super easy to clean. Since we use the matching bottles, I can pump right into them and that’s an added bonus. Highly recommend (as well as the mOmma bottles).
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hand pump to have available when I’m not able to use my electric pump. Or in a pinch when I can’t get a whole pumping session in. I’ve used this twice so far and I like it better than the electric pump! I am able to pump more milk in a shorter period of time. This hand pump is quiet and I can press it as quickly or slowly as a I want to. Surprisingly comfortable! I was able to pump the same amount of ounces in less time. Only drawback is you are only pumping one side at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Quick Option!
customer_reviews.text: I love how quickly I can whip this one out and pump as needed throughout the day. As a busy working mom, I have a hard time finding a minute between meetings to get all hooked up to my electric machine and make time to pump, but knowing I can get in the lactation room and have a good amount pumped in 10 mins or less is awesome! Highly recommend having as an option for new, breastfeeding moms!!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Overall good
customer_reviews.text: Come with clear instruction manual, easy to assemble and disassemble. Once you find a rhythm to pump, it works well but does take time getting used to it as it hurts the hand. This is my first manual pump so I'm assuming others are like that too. Overall good for the price and easy to use and I like that it has a holder for the cup so it sits stably on you while pumping.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy

customer_reviews.title: Super squeaky and loud after a month
customer_reviews.text: I might use this more than I should. I prefer the hand pump to the electric pump for convenience and use it almost exclusively. It now after a month squeaks so loud I ordered a new different pump. I liked that it was quiet so at night I wasn’t waking up my baby pumping - but now that’s not the case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hand pump
customer_reviews.text: I have a 300.00 electric pump so I got this for quick pumps at work. I never used my electric again after using this one!!! I loved it and it was super quick and easy. Don’t waste you money on an expensive one. But this one!
customer_reviews.author: Whitney Roseberg

customer_reviews.title: SO GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I had issues pumping/nursing with my first baby. I tried the same electric pump for baby 2 and still didn't get much. After much research, I decided to give this manual pump a shot. It works beautifully. I have given up on an electric pump and exclusively use this or my haakaa. I still get more from this manual pump than the haakaa though. I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Emily F

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I get more milk with this than my electric pump as well as it's portable that's the main reason i bought it. I have two toddlers and a newborn so i needed something that i could use that was inexpensive and i could use while walking around the house or when I'm out and about. I could not be confined to the outlet with my three kids lol and The portable electric pumps that Go into your bra are so expensive so i opted for this manual pump and i was not disappointed i love it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great manual pump for a quick session/on the go pump.
customer_reviews.text: I use this on the weekends so I don't have to get my breast pump out of my work bag and set it up at home. It works great and I have great output with it! The first couple of times I used it I didn't have much success, but I had never used a manual pump before. Once I figured out the best pattern & pressure to pump with I fell in love with this little pump!
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick & easy pumping without worrying about batteries ...
customer_reviews.text: New mom must! Great for quick & easy pumping without worrying about batteries and lots of extra parts to lug around. I've actually just used this since the birth of our son and haven't even gotten my automatic pump out of the box yet. It's functional and simple- does the trick and I'll definitely be using this for travel as well.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this manual pump! I think I love it more than the actual electric signature double Lansinoh pump I have. The manual allows me to pump as slow or fast as I’d like to, which sometimes seems like I express a lot more manually with this pump more so than with the electric one. Easier to clean than the electric one and I can walk around using it, rather than being secluded next to an outlet! Recommend this pump! Barely makes a sound if you use this to go, and it’s small enough to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: BARELY suctioned. Keep your electric pump...
customer_reviews.text: I’m very confused by all the positive comments. Mine just came and I tried it and the suction is HORRIBLE. It’s barely any suction at all!! The “deep” suction is like having my electric breast pump on level 1 pumping (out of 10). Did I get a faulty one? Or is it supposed to be two levels of shallow pump and extra shallow pump??? Very disappointed how minimal suction it was. I pumped maybe a quarter of an ounce out since it was barely sucking. :(
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because on vacation my baby had problems latching because of teething, & I didn’t have the money for an electric pump for such a short period of time. It worked way better than I expected! It was kind of difficult to get used to physically pumping by hand for so long (about 30mins each side) but I got ~5oz each time. Luckily she’s a little older & only nursing 3xs a day. So I obviously prefer my spectra2 but for a manual pump it ticks all the boxes: efficient, easy to assemble, comes with a bottle & nipple, easy to clean & dry.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Gove

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I own multiple pumps, the free Ameda one through my insurance company, a medela tote bag one, and also have a hospital grade rental. I also use the cups that fit in your bra to pump at work. I just purchased this manual pump because I forgot a pump on a trip recently and manual expression suuuuuuuucked. And I’m going camping in a week so wanted some help. This thing is awesome. It didn’t take long st all, wasn’t hard to use, got a lot of milk out, and was very comfortable. I’m glad to have this now so I don’t have to always use a huge machine! Also was like 40% cheaper than target!
customer_reviews.author: Renee Thielman

customer_reviews.title: Love this manual pump.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for backup in case anything were to ever happen to my electric pump or if I am away from baby and need to use it. I have used it a few times now and REALLY love it. I had the Manual Medela Pump for my previous baby and absolutely HATED it, it hurt so badly. This Manual Lansinoh Pump is very comfortable and efficient. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amy_Ro

customer_reviews.title: Very friendly to those who are sensitive to pain but suction is very limited.
customer_reviews.text: When I get sore, I use this manual pump. It’s so soft and not painful to use, but the downside is suction is very weak and you won’t get close to what your normal milk production. It feels more like massage. If you’re not in hurry, pump longer maybe for 30 mins or so to get to a decent production level, unfortunately. That’s why I give it 3 stars, but it’s very friendly to those who are very sensitive to pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mocha

customer_reviews.title: Most uncomfortable least milk producing pump ever
customer_reviews.text: Worst pump I've ever used and this is my 3rd manual pump. I prefer the manual to the electric so u go through them quickly. This pump was absolutely awful. Uncomfortable and not tight enough even with the two sizes. Pulled too much extra skin into the pump and got less than one oz after 20 min of uncomfortable pumping when i usuallu get 4. Returning it. Horrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Deb G.

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassingly squeaky and wakes baby
customer_reviews.text: I like the suction ability of this pump, but on day 2 it started squeaking from the silicone ring at the top that creates suction. I tried to use coconut oil to lubricate that area, but it didn’t work! So bummed because I’m embarrassed to use this loud thing in public and need to go to a different room to pump at night so I don’t wake the baby. Huge bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Skye Miller

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work- not even a drop!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a backup for when I don’t want to/don’t need to electric pump. But Of course I got it too early in the pregnancy to test it out during the return window- big mistake. I can’t get a single drop with this thing- or any suction at all. Can’t tell if it’s the flange or the duckbills which both had gaps straight out of the box, but either way it’s a big disappointment
customer_reviews.author: sonja :)

customer_reviews.title: LOVE
customer_reviews.text: This manual pump is great! I hate setting up my electrical one. This is super easy to use and I've noticed i get the same amount of milk out in less time then i would with my electric pump!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi Quirk

customer_reviews.title: Worth it! No hand cramps here!
customer_reviews.text: Super comfortable, I didn’t even get a hand cramp. Only complain is the water is hard to get out the diaphragm area. Use one hand to to hold the flange and the other to pump. Love it! Wish I had bought sooner! Makes me hate my Ameda electric pump even more! This has just enough suction without being painful!
customer_reviews.author: SKE

customer_reviews.title: No suction at all
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if the one I got is defective or broken but I get absolutely no milk coming out. There is literally no suction and this was a total waste of money. I’m extremely disappointed and unhappy.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Anne

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t get to use mine the seal came broken, which obviously indicates it was a returned item. :( I thought maybe it was a mistake unfortunately when I opened the box it had water spots on the flanges so this was definitely a returned item.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: So glad I bought this. I never intended it to be used, just as a backup or travel item. When I started getting damaged boobs from pumping a lot (we had issues getting started), I gave this a try and whoa! No idea something totally manual could work this well. I haven't used my electric again, I'll now keep it at work when I got back and use this at home. It was so nice to be able to control suction so I could get out my milk effectively during a letdown but back off if it started to hurt. My boobs healed up from the electric in a couple of weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree

customer_reviews.title: High quality!!
customer_reviews.text: This pump is amazing. I also have the medella electric pump and the medella manual pump and I still prefer this over both. I can tell that I am able to pump more milk with this one and it is much more comfortable to hold and is much more durable than medella. The tray that you can place the pump in makes it so that the pump does not tip over or spill. The let down feature helped my milk supply immensely. I would definitely recommend this product to anyone planning to breast feed. My only regret is that for my electric pump I bought a medella and not the lansinoh brand!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Suction and Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I have larger breasts and this did not work for me. The suction was poor and the milk leaked out the bottom because of the poor seal on my boob. Now some might say need a bigger flange but it’s the right size for me based on my use of other pumps. I plan to get my money back if I can.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have on hand.
customer_reviews.text: Lots of parts to clean, but this is so easy to throw in your bag when you’re on the go. I use it mostly when I don’t think a haakaa will be enough, but I don’t want to drag my Spectra out with me. The soft purple edges of the flanges are so comfortable! I just wish it came with an extra bottle. It’s definitely worth it to have this on hand though!
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Total Milk Saver
customer_reviews.text: I needed an alternative to my electronic pump as I felt it was awkward to pump with and inconvenient at times. This pump allowed me to pump whenever I needed to. I also am attempting to build a milk storage and was able to pump 4oz of milk in a single session with this pump. It would take me multiple sessions to produce that with my electric pump. So happy I bought this!
customer_reviews.author: Roxxstarreader

customer_reviews.title: Forget electric, this is magic
customer_reviews.text: This lil guy is all you need! I was on the hunt for the perfect pump. Everybody raves on the Spectra electric pump (of which I have never tried) But nothing gives me more milk than this! No cords, no bulk. This pump has sustained me thru 2 month hospital stay. I'm impatiant and prefer to pump at my own strength and rhythm. And that is something I can only do with a manual
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: Love the flange
customer_reviews.text: I like the flange on this pump better than the Medela but felt like the Medela had a little more suction power. I'm a fan of Lansinoh brand so I thought I would like this better than the Medela, but I didn't. It does a decent job but I just personally liked the Medela a little better.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable pump with some minor issues
customer_reviews.text: I love the dual settings on this product; even though I found the instructions a little confusing. It has good suction and the 2 flange options were nice. The flanges are pretty flimsy, but comfortable. My biggest complaint is that milk leans forward on the flange toward the breast and I am often wiping milk off
customer_reviews.author: Anna McKie

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely silent hand pump
customer_reviews.text: Love how easy this pump is to use! Don't forget about the adjustable top to add more suction to each pump. Bumping up the power made this thing way better than my electric pump. Only downside is the difficulty in cleaning. Wish I didn't have to break it down into so many pieces to clean it properly.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought it sooner! I prefer pumping with this manually than with my spectra 2. Very easy to use, to clean and most importantly very very effective. It reduces my pumping time to less than half. I don't know about durability I only had it for a few days but I love it! Update. I have completely abandoned my double electric pump for this one! Still absolutely love it! Only problem it gets squicky some times..
customer_reviews.author: Nikoleta

customer_reviews.title: Best baby item I own- have three kids
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely buy this. This item is the only reason I’m able to consistently pump. So easy to use while still living your life- instead of being stuck tucked away plugged into the wall with the electric. Much less parts to clean. I get more manually pumping than my spectra s2 or Medela PIS. I would recommend this to anyone who is nursing.
customer_reviews.author: Lynsey B

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pump! I was having trouble producing enough milk so I got this pump to pump more during the day then I could with the electric pump and I noticed an increase in my milk supply. It has a good suction and I feel like it extracts all the milk! Great product, would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amywink84

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel! Great suction.
customer_reviews.text: I love this more than my electric double pump! Easy to use in the car (I’ve done this a few times) and around the house if you are trying to build your supply. I wouldn’t recommend it at work if you have a limited amount of time to pump as it takes longer to empty breasts. Can’t beat the easy clean up and not being tied to an outlet though!
customer_reviews.author: L. Smalley

customer_reviews.title: So convenient
customer_reviews.text: I use this pump every single day as my main pump. I don't like using the electric pump because it's such a big contraption and I need to be flexible when I'm in the car headed to appointments coming from appointments and at work. I have two other children and I can't be stuck sitting somewhere with a big machine attached to me for too long. In between me cooking I use this pump. It's easy to pump a little and then sitting in my refrigerator and then resume pumping you can't do that with an electric pump this is so convenient and I actually want to buy a another one one for home one for work and out about.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Norris

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase! Go ahead and buy one!
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this pump to my electric one. Easy to clean and fits perfectly into my baby super bag. All the control is in your hands and believe it or not it gets the job done faster
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Cauthen

customer_reviews.title: Not worth buying
customer_reviews.text: My Medela hand pump, unfortunately, stopped working so I wanted to try a competitors brand. This is not worth buying, it barely pumps. Don't waste your money. Medela ended up sending me a new hand pump, which I prefer much better.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Great for middle of the night
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have insurance or need something super quiet, this is for you. You also end up getting a hand workout as you use it. I tend to use this for middle of the night, just to take the edge off things. The base also helps keep from tipping very well.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca B

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy I purchased this. It's been perfect for middle of the night when my son only feeds from one side and passes out, allowing me to quietly pump my other side in a few minutes without having to set up my electric pump. I've also taken it with me when I've been gone for several hours and need to release some pressure but can't haul the electric pump around and hope for an outlet. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Julie LB

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I just purchased this and it’s freaking awesome! I have 3 month old twins that I exclusively breastfeed and if I get time I pump after but now that they’re sleeping longer through the night I wanted to find something faster and more quiet..this is IT!! It’s totally worth the price. I know there’s other brands which I chose this one because I read it’s good for people with big nipples (which is me lol) but anyway. I just fed my girls and pumped 3 oz in less than 6 minutes. Silently!!☺️☺️☺️Also this would have saved my life a few months ago whenever all I did was pump and my electricity went out.
customer_reviews.author: Goonjah

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and clean. Super convenient for those overnights when my son is extra sleepy and only half-eats. The suction is ok, obviously nothing like an electric pump but also not as good as some others. For the price this is an essential item for a breastfeeding mama.
customer_reviews.author: kiki

customer_reviews.title: Better than my electric pump!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this pump! It was so nice to have for on the go and even sometimes I just preferred to use this one because I felt like I got more milk than using my electric one. It takes a little getting used to but once you do it's really easy to use!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Packaging looked like used.
customer_reviews.text: The packaging looked very unprofessional with some holes in the plastic covers containing pump parts. Like someone manually used fire to seal the packets. Dunno if that is the case for everyone. Anyway this is not useful for me at all. Got tired after pumping for 5 mins. Also flange rim was wavy. So it didnt create enough suction. Maybe it is for someone with oversupply.
customer_reviews.author: TwinkleBaby

customer_reviews.title: Saved my supply! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: I was using a brand new Medela double electric pump & wasn't producing enough each session for one feeding. I was about ready to give up breastfeeding when I tried this manual pump. I get 2-3oz on each side when I could barely get 2oz total with my Medela. My only complaint is there's a few books & crannies where the flange attached that I have to use a Q-tip to clean out. But I'll take that over completely needing to quit BF.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This did not work for me at all. The first time I used it, I got less than an ounce after 30 minutes. The second time I got absolutely nothing after 45 minutes. The only reason I kept trying that long was because my electric pump broke and I was waiting for the replacement. The suction is so minimal, it was useless.
customer_reviews.author: melg

customer_reviews.title: Way better than Medela!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Medela first and the suction was incredibly weak. I couldn’t even pump an ounce and I am an over producer. I decided to try another brand and this is AH-MAZING! I pumped 4 ounces in a blink of an eye! I was traveling and I wanted to have this to make things easy. Every mama needs this for emergency quick relief situations!
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Better than Medela
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it’s sometimes a hassle to use my electric Medela pump. This pump seriously works and I was able to get more milk! When I use the Medela I only get about 2-3 ounces and I was able to get right over 4 ounces! Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & Alyssa Harle

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only used this once so I can’t really tell you how well it works, but I will say that the customer service is incredible! My duckbills were slightly open when I received it, so it wasn’t working. As soon as I contacted Lansinoh, I got an email from a REAL PERSON who FIXED MY PROBLEM! I received brand new awesome duckbills within a week. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: LW

customer_reviews.title: Great pump
customer_reviews.text: Great manual pump. I was between getting this one or the Medela one. I choose this one because it comes with 2 different flanges sizes which is perfect for me since I use a 28mm. I have used this many times now when out and about or at home when I don’t feel like dealing with my electric pump. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Great buy- every breastfeeding mom should have one!
customer_reviews.text: I never knew I would need a manual pump, considering I used an electric double pump, but it’s SO USEFUL to have a manual on hand for clogs or uneven feeds! Quick to set up and use, and I got a lot of milk out fast! Comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Howlett

customer_reviews.title: Good pump, bad bottles
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars for the pump itself, very easy to operate with one hand and has great suction. -2 stars because it’s only compatible with Lansinoh bottles (why doesn’t Lansinoh sell extra bottles with normal lids?) I exclusively pump and pumping is only half the battle, storing milk and washing pump parts is the other half and Lansinoh creates more work for me in those areas.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica M Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and clean. I get as much with this as I do my spectra pump! I use this when I need to pump and be mobile, like chase after my 3 year old! Good in a pinch for quick relief, or an easy way to build up a stash. I use this after the morning feeding and easily get 3 oz to store every day.
customer_reviews.author: Jackie

product_meta.title: Lansinoh Manual Breast Pump with Stimulation and Expression Modes, Single Pump Included, Hand Pump for Breastfeeding, Quiet for Travel, Pumping Essentials
product_meta.description: The Lansinoh Manual Breast Pump offers a convenient and quiet pumping solution at an affordable price. Manual breast pumps are great for the mom who is pumping occasionally. A manual breastmilk pump gives mom the ability to pump anywhere because it’s compact, lightweight and doesn’t require electric power. The Lansinoh Manual breast pump uses innovative two-phase technology to conveniently and comfortably express breastmilk. The handle of the pump adjusts to easily switch between Stimulation and Expression phases. The Stimulation phase allows more rapid suction, similar to baby’s suction pattern at the beginning of a breastfeed, to elicit a letdown. Once milk starts flowing, it’s easy to switch to the Expression phase which provides slower cycles with more suction to efficiently express breastmilk. The ergonomic easy-express handle allows for comfortable positioning to reduce hand fatigue, and two flange sizes, standard (25mm) and large (30.5mm), ensure ideal suction and pumping comfort. The soft rim on the flanges provides a more comfortable experience and creates a better seal when pumping. Lansinoh milk collection bottles are designed to fit the full Lansinoh breast pump, milk storage and baby bottle feeding range. Includes a storage lid for convenient breastmilk bottle storage and NaturalWave nipple with collar & cover so baby can be fed directly from the same bottle used for pumping. Also, now pump directly into Lansinoh Breastmilk Storage Bags with the use of any Lansinoh breast pump to save time and reduce breastmilk transfer. Founded by a breastfeeding mom, Lansinoh has been committed to helping moms succeed in breastfeeding for over 30 years. Lansinoh is a leader in breastfeeding products and accessories, famous for its award-winning cornerstone product Lansinoh lanolin and Lansinoh nursing pads. For more information, please visit Lansinoh.com or connect with us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Pinterest and YouTube. Do not fill past the 6oz mark.
feature_bullets: Comfortable for Mom: ComfortFit Flanges have a soft, flexible rim that's soft on mom's skin while maintaining a good seal for optimal suction
Easy to Use: This lightweight portable hand breast pump is designed with an Easy Express Handle to reduce hand fatigue while pumping
Efficient Pumping: Our adjustable two mode technology gets milk flowing during the letdown phase before maximizing milk flow with the expression phase

Convenient and Portable: This Lansinoh breast pump is easy to clean, easy to use, and easy to assemble. All parts that come into contact with breastmilk are dishwasher safe. Lightweight and easy to fit into your bag, perfect for pumping on the go
Lansinoh Compatible: Works with Lansinoh breastmilk storage bags and Lansinoh baby bottles for a consistent, convenient experience

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
